segments.text: Ok , honey , time to take down the Christmas tree .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Come on , it ’ s losing needles all the time and the branches are sagging .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It ’ s not that bad , besides it really looks nice in that corner . It gives the room a good atmosphere .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: A good atmosphere ? The tree is falling apart , and it ’ s messing up the room .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But it makes the place feel so much like Christmas . I ’ d really hate to have to take it down .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But Christmas was two weeks ago ! It ’ s been there only because we ’ Ve been too busy to get rid of it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know , but it seems like such a shame to have to take it away .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But it ’ s falling apart , and the cat keeps playing with the lower branches .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know , I know . But it reminds me of the great Christmas we just had . All of us were here - - my parents , your parents , the kids , and the cousins - - the food was good , and everybody got what they wanted .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , it was a good Christmas . It won ’ t always be this good , but we can ’ t make it last longer than it should .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok , fine . We need to take down the tree .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ ll make a deal with you . We ’ ll leave it up until Sunday , and then we ’ ll take it down after church .
segments.speaker: S1
